website_summaries.verdict: 16-ounce whole-bean, cold-brew organic coffee, made by a company supporting reforestation in Ecuador.
pros: "Craft" roasted in an old-fashioned Probat drum roaster updated with modern fuel-efficient ribbon burners, for consistently superior roast
Smooth, rich flavor, with fruit and floral notes
Manufacturer claims partnership with the Mindo Cloudforest Foundation, supporting reforestation in Ecuador
cons: A minority didn't like it or think it was special

customer_reviews.title: Terrible tasting cold brew
customer_reviews.text: I wholly support a "green" company and respect their efforts on that end, and it is the only reason I gave it 2 stars as opposed to 1. But this coffee makes weak and terrible tasting cold brew. Comes out a light brown water, and that's after over 48 hours of brewing. I've been making cold brews for almost 2 years, so the ratios of coffee to water were all correct. Do yourself a favor. Get Starbucks Ethiopia and have them grind it on "french press" (the coarsest setting they offer). It makes an excellent cold brew.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Bells

customer_reviews.title: Great Taste, Great Company
customer_reviews.text: I love this coffee. I bought it to make cold-brew iced coffee and was nervous that getting it pre-ground would make the taste unacceptable. On the contrary, it's great. Delicious, and it couldn't be easier to make! (I use the Kungprocoffee maker and it's a 2-minute cinch. I also love Tiny Footprint's environmental profile. Great company, great value, great products. Who could ask for more?
customer_reviews.author: Dana W.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This coffee is amazing! Bought this and Starbucks whole beans Starbucks was good but this was amazing! Tried Rook cold brew and liked what I made at home much better! I used the 1 quart cold brew best selling pot. Very easy to make. Love both! This is less expensive on Amazon than it is on the companies site.
customer_reviews.author: GSap

customer_reviews.title: I love everything about this.
customer_reviews.text: This makes the best iced coffee ever! It's convenient and so much less expensive than iced coffee you would buy anywhere else. It also keeps you from having to drink yesterday's leftover coffee that's been refrigerated as a restaurant's misguided attempt at iced coffee. The flavor is smooth and rich. I put not quite a cup of grounds in an ice coffee brewer with just under a liter of filtered water. 12-14 hours later I've got delicious coffee to enjoy year round. If you haven't tried iced coffee brewed the RIGHT way, try this. You'll be converted instantly.
customer_reviews.author: K Brooks

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend this for people who really enjoy coldbrew
customer_reviews.text: If you drink your cold brew black- do not get this coffee. It's bitter- not smooth. If you drink it with milk or some sort of sweetner it may be bearable. I do not recommend this for people who really enjoy coldbrew. Go with the stone street cold brew reserve instead
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Smooth, mild flavor...I prefer a bolder taste.
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a handful of brands to make cold brew at home. I love the business model behind Tiny Footprint, but it's not my favorite flavor. Some people may love it, but I prefer a bolder taste than this. It is smooth, but too mild for me. I have noticed this brand and one other leave behind a film or coffee residue during and after brewing. My favorite brand does not do this and it has a smooth, bold flavor. Perhaps they use a different process to grind it and there are finer grounds within it which leave the residue behind.
customer_reviews.author: Hatallah

customer_reviews.title: 5.27 ACIDITY. (That’s low.) Medium taste. Stone Street beats it.
customer_reviews.text: The acidity is low compared to others. It’s in the lowest 25% of acidic cold brews. (See my reviews of cold brews to judge.) This is brewed as a concentrate that is then diluted to 1 part coffee concentrate to 2 parts water. The taste is a 6 out of 10 though... and Stone Street has a similar coffee that tastes like a 9... but with zero environmental benefit. I would encourage anyone who consumes coffee w creamers and sugars to use this one. If you fast, or drink black coffee that is mandatory for your work... this won’t do it. Go to Stone Street.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Spanky Of Nazareth

customer_reviews.title: Great light coffee
customer_reviews.text: I bought this coffee for my cold press machine. It tastes really good and smooth, not as acidic-ey as normal coffee. Not that I don't love normal hot coffee, but when it's over 100 at 7am it was time to put the normal French press away and try something different.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Quincy

customer_reviews.title: Did not love the flavor - reminded me of French roast
customer_reviews.text: This is so subjective! The coffee is actual coffee and I love the idea of carbon negative, but I didn't love the taste, I found myself adding a squirt of flavor syrup to drown it out. It tasted kind of like French roast to me, which I hate, but if you love French roast this may be the ideal one for you. Other than that it was fine, seemed to do well as a cold press, as advertised. My recipe is one cup of ground in a french press, fill up with water and let sit on counter for 24 hours. I got another brand to compare and I like the second one much better.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Got the light & dark roasts which I never had, PERFECT TASTE!!  Love the carbon negative part!
customer_reviews.text: Best organic cold brew coffee I've had, I LOVE THIS COMPANY'S IMPACT ON THE PLANET!! I ONLY BUY THIS BRAND!! AMAZON HAS AN AWESOME TALL $20 COLD BREW COFFEE PITCHER & STAINLESS STEEL STRAINER SO YOU CAN CONVENIENTLY BREW OVERNIGHT. YOU CAN ALSO USE THE STRAINER FOR OTHER OPTIONS TOO LIKE PRESSING JUICE AND BREWING TEA. I'M GRATEFUL FOR THE SUPERB TASTE, ORGANIC INTEGRITY, AND CARBON IMPACT OF THIS PRODUCT. GREAT KARMA WITH EVERY PURCHASE IS ALWAYS THE BEST FOR ME!
customer_reviews.author: Kendallyn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cold brew coffee
customer_reviews.text: Excellent coffee. Use it with my cold brew maker I also got off Amazon, and I put some sugar free caramel and hemp milk in my coffee and have the perfect substitute for 10 cents a day instead of $7/day coffee I would get at Black Rock. It also feels good to know that while this coffee is smooth, rich, potent and extremely delicious - it is also engaging in charitable work which obviously makes me feel better about buying from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Alysha Chandra

customer_reviews.title: Delicious coffee, but doesn’t always survive shipping
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying this coffee for six months now and it is my favorite for cold brew. Unfortunately, the packaging is not air-tight/vacuum sealed. It was fine back when the weather was a little better, but now that it’s the height of summer the grounds spoiled by heat and humidity more often than not. If you live somewhere with very high heat and humidity, best to look for a different brand until the temps come down.
customer_reviews.author: Mololock

customer_reviews.title: Great choice for starting cold brewing
customer_reviews.text: Been buying this for a few years and it never disappoints! This coffee is a great way to get started cold brewing, which is a fantastic way in and of itself to save money. One of the reasons this is a great choice is because it's a coarse ground. That's the best type to use for cold brewing so that you don't block up a mesh filter (if using one.) This in a Hario or Takeya is really the perfect fit. Leave the grounds in there maybe 18-24 hours, pour over ice and enjoy. Many people like to dilute it with water, but I say no to that for a coffee as strong as the day ahead. :)
customer_reviews.author: Andruler

customer_reviews.title: I like it! Great coffee, saves money in the long run
customer_reviews.text: Delicious coffee, a bit pricey but it's worth it. It has a nice mild flavor and it's refreshing (seems strange to describe a coffee that way but it is!), but I don't leave this coffee in the coffee maker for too long, so it could certainly be brewed to be stronger. Works well with my cold brew coffee maker. I had no issues with grounds leaking into the coffee, it was the perfect ground size. I will definitely be buying again, much better than any other cold brew I'd have and in the long run its much less expensive than buying from a fast food coffee place.
customer_reviews.author: Chimney161Top Contributor: Minecraft

customer_reviews.title: Liked the idea of it but disliked the flavor.
customer_reviews.text: We really wanted to like this coffee. But it just wasn’t meant to be. The flavor just wasn’t right for us. Maybe others would like it, but we really didnt much care for it. We still finished it off, but were very happy when when it was finally gone. Also, the bag it came in was not as good as others and wouldn’t stand up, kinda annoying, but total first world problem.
customer_reviews.author: Plumb

customer_reviews.title: Makes a good cold brew
customer_reviews.text: I use this occasionally for making cold brew using a pitcher with a metal infuser/strainer that is specifically marketed for cold brewing coffee. I am far from a coffee expert, but I find this to have a smooth and enjoyable taste. I use approximately 3/4 cup of grounds per 32 oz of water, brewed overnight. This produces a concentrate that I dilute with an equal part milk when drinking. I find that some very fine grounds escape the infuser and end up in the bottom of my pitcher; however, I consider that unavoidable with my current setup, and I just take care not to disturb the contents at the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Rae

customer_reviews.title: Awesome flavor.
customer_reviews.text: Just ventured into the world of cold brew and I was using the Starbucks roast from Costco. I'd grind them fresh and cold brew. It tasted pretty good until I tried this one on a whim... Oh boy the flavor was much better! Not that the Starbucks beans were "bad", but the Tiny Footprint's cold brew blend offered a much complex flavor that was very rich. I'm in love and will definitely keep buying these. I really appreciate the company's business ethics as well.
customer_reviews.author: V.L.

customer_reviews.title: Lovley, Fresh, Coarse Graound and Perfect for Cold Brew or French Press
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered a few of these now and it has become my new favorite coffee for cold brew. The grind is nice and course and has been fresh every time I have opened the bag, unlike a few more expensive brands I have purchased on Amazon that came fancifully packaged, but whose aroma fell short when the sealed bag was opened. The taste, even with cold brew is complex and caffeine level is....potent. After a big serving of this a humming bird cant keep up with me.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. BBQ guy

customer_reviews.title: Quality Choice for Cold Brew
customer_reviews.text: I am drinking cold-brewed Tiny Footprint right now as I write this review and, after finishing off my first pound, can report that I have been very happy with the taste from this coffee. The grind is a tad inconsistent (reason for the -1 star) so you get a slightly dirty cup depending on your brewing method, but the taste is great and worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Henrichs

customer_reviews.title: A bit sour
customer_reviews.text: Good coffee mostly comes down to personal taste provided the beans aren't burnt or otherwise just poor quality. But while these aren't burnt or poor quality, they aren't for me. I don't care for the mix of light and dark. It created an almost sour flavor that wasn't terrible, but, again, just wasn't for me. It wasn't as even as I would have liked and as I most often prefer.
customer_reviews.author: Doctor Bertram

customer_reviews.title: Hubby liked his gift!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband who recently started making his own cold brew. I saw that this was highly rated and did some reading about it so I decided to give it a try. He really enjoyed it! He had been purchasing different coffee beans from the grocery store and he said he could notice the difference between this one and others he'd tried before. It's a winner!
customer_reviews.author: LL

customer_reviews.title: Cold or hot this coffee is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I used this coffee to make a jug of cold brew coffee concentrate to make ice coffee from. I needed a course ground coffee but didn’t want to skimp on quality. I am coffee snob. I hate nasty coffee. This coffee is so smooth, rich and a party in my mouth. Definitely ordering it again!
customer_reviews.author: chucker

customer_reviews.title: Tastes Great
customer_reviews.text: I don't often leave reviews but this coffee is great. I made a batch of cold brew using my Crave cold brew jar and it honestly tasted just as good as the cold brew from my local coffee shop. This was a pleasant treat during all this social distancing. FWIW, I let it brew for a full 24 hours before enjoying and used spring water instead of tap water. Anyway, thanks for the great product. Will definitely order more!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Williams

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome blend of coffee, grounded perfectly for making cold brew. Good for if you are just getting into making cold brew at home. Is has a subtle chocolate note. The part I like about it the most is it has sore carbon footprint.
customer_reviews.author: Boya

customer_reviews.title: Lacks the bold flavor I'm looking for
customer_reviews.text: I've brewed this a few times under different circumstances and the flavor is just lacking. I like the idea, but I won't buy again since I know there are others available that taste bold and consistent every time.
customer_reviews.author: SeaHaucks

customer_reviews.title: I think I'm in love
customer_reviews.text: This coffee is so good. I love cold brew but didn't try making it myself until recently. This was only the second brand I've tried and it is perfect! Not bitter or sour, and it's very smooth. I did a 1:6 ratio as suggested, but for my next brew I plan to make it a little stronger. With a little creamer it tastes just like my favorite coffee shop cold brew! And the fact that the company is so eco friendly is a major plus! Will definitely be buying this again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Favourite coffee but it KEEPS coming to me already opened.
customer_reviews.text: Please find new packaging or seal all the way. The last time I received it was packaged in the same box as kitty liter. And as always the bag was already open and got mixed with scented cat litter. Disgusting. I will change my rating if Its sealed for once.
customer_reviews.author: madison b.

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: I've tried about 5 different coffee brands to make cold brew in the last month. I usually let it sit there for 48 hours minimum. It was not as strong as others and had a bitter after taste.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Light but Weak
customer_reviews.text: Flavor is ok, very light and sweet. However, it's so light it barely tastes like cold brew coffee. I steeped for 24 hours at room temperature, even tried again with high bean-water ratio (1.5oz to 1cup) and it still was weak. Could be great for people who dont usually like coffee much.
customer_reviews.author: MLB

customer_reviews.title: Solid cold brew
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good cold brew. It has a brighter, fruitier flavor which is not my personal preference, but my husband loves it. I did a blind taste test of four cold brews for my husband, and he picked this one as his favorite served concentrated, normal, and with milk.
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: Wow this stuff is actually excellent
customer_reviews.text: I have been making cold brew but unable to get the right beans to make a great cup. The trick seemed to be these beans. So well balanced and smooth with being overly bitter or acidic. Man this is a real winner. I did think I’d be this impressed. Only wish is that I had ordered whole beans but that seems to be a minor issue given how good it came out anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Savvy Internet Shopper

customer_reviews.title: TOP QUALITY COFFEE and I WILL BUY AGAIN... and AGAIN and, well You get the Idea :)
customer_reviews.text: Best Coffee I ever drank. I'm not a big coffee person like I used to be but I DO know the difference between good coffee and great coffee and Tiny Footprint ranks #1 in taste and non-acidic, at ltast not with my stomach anyway, plus I make it like traditional coffee, aka coffeemaker vs cold brew.
customer_reviews.author: JustCallMeD.

customer_reviews.title: Delicious Cold Brew
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an add on with a cold brew coffee one gallon glass jar. So I have about a weeks worth of coffee sitting in my fridge at any given time. This coffee is delicious, I drink it with a bit of creamer and I love it. The flavor isn’t too bold but it’s just tasty and worth buying again and again. The husband loves it too and is drinking more coffee now than he used to haha.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Reiblich

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Cold Brew Blend!
customer_reviews.text: I am a recent convert to coffee drinking, (I am a tea drinker), and really haven't liked the acid taste in coffee. I switched to cold brew, which helped, but it wasn't until I tried the Tiny Footprint Cold Brew coffee that I could say I had finally found the coffee taste I want! This coffee blend is fantastic, no acid aftertaste. I will definitely buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: pleahy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to make, great taste & no bitterness
customer_reviews.text: I don’t profess to be a coffee aficionado by any means, but I really like this cold brew coffee. I don’t taste that harsh bitterness that I taste in other coffees. I’m just getting into the cold brewing habit & I’m so liking this brand that I think it’ll be my go to brand from here on out. And I love that they’re using proceeds from their coffee sales to plant trees!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Cavanaugh

customer_reviews.title: The cold brew tasted fine, but it wasn't anything special
customer_reviews.text: The cold brew tasted fine, but it wasn't anything special. The thing I hated the most though would be the bag. This is a super cheap bag that was difficult to open. When it did get open, it ripped awkwardly so each time I went to make coffee it would spill and I was reminded of how bad the bag was, which made me mad. If the coffee was in a nicer bag I would give it a higher rating.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: It’s good !!
customer_reviews.text: I Recently got into making cold brew coffee this coffee makes some of the best cold brew I have tasted and I have tried so far about eight different coffees. Kind of pricey but I believe you get what you pay for and plus this brand has a negative carbon footprint which is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Jones

customer_reviews.title: Bad flavor
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying a lot of different cold brew coffee lately. Most of the fancier ones are great and usually the middle range ones are pretty good. This is the ONLY one I wont ever drink again bc the flavor is bad.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. E

customer_reviews.title: Nothing special
customer_reviews.text: Beans tasted like what you would get from a bulk container. Basically the same as if you purchased a bag of beans from the grocery store. Despite the name it's really to weak for cold brewing, after 24 hours the coffee is still transparent when it should be dark. This experience just reinforced my belief that coffee needs to come from a local roaster.
customer_reviews.author: jeffrey cowen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cold brew coffee
customer_reviews.text: Excellent cold brew coffee. Great price considering it’s organic & ethically sourced. I made this in a low-tech mason jar cold brewer with simple filter & left it 12 hours at minimum, at room temp, to brew. We have 3 people in our house drinking this so I’m ready to buy it again & have no reason to try another brand. We are happy!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Boyfriend loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift for my boyfriend who loves making cold brew at home. He said it's the best he's had, and our roommate agreed. They've tried many different brands, so I trust their opinion!
customer_reviews.author: tuesday

customer_reviews.title: Delicious cold brew coffee
customer_reviews.text: This produces delicious cold brew coffee. Very smooth, with almost caramel notes. We use it as a concentrate in a 1 (part coffee) to 3 (parts milk and/or water) mixture. This is our new go-to cold brew coffee! Next time we'll probably purchase the whole beans so we can grind them ourselves for even more flavor.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Best Cold Brew Grounds
customer_reviews.text: I don’t write many reviews, but I feel a need to express my love for this cold brew. It’s smooth and flavorful. Most importantly, it doesn’t taste sour or burnt. Based on reviews, I have tried Bizzy, Stone Street, and Cold Brew Lab. I KEEP coming back to Tiny Footprint.
customer_reviews.author: cdupree

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for my cold brew for the past few weeks. It's a course ground, which is good for the reusable filter I use. It makes strong iced coffee, not too bitter. I also love the idea that their coffee is carbon-negative. Definitely going to buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Nah.
customer_reviews.text: Worst tasting coffee ever made. GREAT idea but gotta get the flavor figured out.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Gravitt

customer_reviews.title: Good Cold Brew
customer_reviews.text: I use this with the Filtron Cold Brewer. To be honest, I can't taste the difference between this and the other cold brew coffee grinds I buy.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Awful tasting coffee
customer_reviews.text: Made this in a cold brew pot. The taste is awful, but I do understand taste is a subjective thing but I had other people taste and they all agreed. My experience is that it makes an awful tasting cold brew. Double bonus...can’t return skunk coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Kona's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great for Toddy Cold Brewer Coffee
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my Toddy cold brew system! It’s ground, but coarse and worked great! The taste is amazing! Very smooth and not at all bitter! I will be a repeat buyer of this coffee! Yum!
customer_reviews.author: Fantaska78

customer_reviews.title: Prefect for your cold brew system
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my rj3 cold brew system and it's great (the rj3 is also great, I have two so there's always one brewing). I keep coming back to this coffee mostly because I'm too lazy to grind that much with my burr grinder, and I get 4 or so brews out of one bag, but also because it tastes great!
customer_reviews.author: Brie

customer_reviews.title: Tried using this for cold brew and also through regular ...
customer_reviews.text: Tried using this for cold brew and also through regular drip machine. Both methods left a stale bitter taste. I expected a low acidity, smooth coffee but this wasnt drinkable for myslef or anyone in my office. I respect what they are accomplishing but this definitely wasnt for me.
customer_reviews.author: MFMJV

customer_reviews.title: Received Expired Product
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to try this coffee, but I received a product that was nearly 3 months past the “Best By” date on the package. I was expecting a fresh product, not something this old. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Keri

customer_reviews.title: Great for cold brewing
customer_reviews.text: This coffee has a magnificently fresh and bold smell, I knew it would taste good as soon as I opened the bag. I keep a shot glass in my office for "measuring coffee grounds". After some experimentation, I found that about 3.5 shot glasses of these grounds soaked in 1 liter of water for about 24 hours yields the perfect cold brew for my taste, but YMMV.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Great Cold Brew Beans.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is awesome for cold brew coffee. I often grind my own beans, which can leave them bitter and can take time to grind enough for brewing.. This is a perfect blend of light and dark roast beans, at the right granular size\ for cold brew filtration. I don't see myself going back to my old beans.
customer_reviews.author: JustInBuffalo

customer_reviews.title: Top Notch Bean!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried every organic bean I can find for my homemade cold brew— this was the best taste by far! And I’ve been using it in my French press for my bulletproof coffee— also best I’ve had so far! Excellent bean they have!
customer_reviews.author: Jake S.

customer_reviews.title: Bitter
customer_reviews.text: I hate to say it but this was bitter as heck. Had to dump it. And I used an actual cold brew coffee maker and measured exactly.
customer_reviews.author: Anne E.

customer_reviews.title: Best cold brew I’ve tried.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been obsessed with cold brew coffee for almost 10 years. I’ve probably ‘tested’ over 50 different brands, grinds, and techniques. This coffee is the best I’ve tried and the closest I can get to the richness of Starbucks cold brew. It has a slight woodiness but is also pleasantly sweet with a slight chocolate after taste. Zero bitterness. I love this coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: If you like smoked coffee, this cold brew is fit you :P
customer_reviews.text: This cold brew is just ok. I find it has VERY smoky undertones, not roasted flavor but almost over the line essence of charcoal. I put coconut cream and stevia in my coffee, so it masks the smoke flavor, but I will not be finishing the bag or buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha Stryker

customer_reviews.title: This stuff isn't horrible but I am not enthusiastic to drink it
customer_reviews.text: This stuff isn't horrible but I am not enthusiastic to drink it. It has a weird blank space in its flavor profile that I can't seem fix with cream or sugar. Once I even tried adding a little salt, but it was still weird.
customer_reviews.author: N B

customer_reviews.title: Great for cold brew
customer_reviews.text: Coarse ground coffee. It's perfect for cold brew! Does not taste acidic. I am using it for bulletproof coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Ellezee

customer_reviews.title: Wish it was mine
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a pollyanna gift to go with a cold brew coffee maker. Smells amazing! Delivery was fast even during the holiday season. I will find out if it tastes as good as it smells after my coworker has tried it!
customer_reviews.author: cocomix

customer_reviews.title: Great for using in a cold brew maker!
customer_reviews.text: I use these grounds with my Takeya cold brew maker and they work perfectly! The taste and quality of the coffee they produce is great. Highly recommend! Great value for the price too.
customer_reviews.author: mary n.

customer_reviews.title: Love this coffee and this company!
customer_reviews.text: It is a fantastic bargain. The company is socially responsible. Coffee brews beautifully cold coffee that taste amazing!
customer_reviews.author: RN Jacobsen

customer_reviews.title: Convenient & Tasty
customer_reviews.text: Love the fact that it is ground and ready for French press. This coffee is smooth, not very acidic, very easy on the mouth and stomach. Still it’s lacking some sort of “flash” or “pizzaz” that makes it only 4 stars not 5.
customer_reviews.author: Gardlo

customer_reviews.title: Smooth Cold Brew
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed this blend for my cold brew. Has a really smooth taste. Grounds are the perfect size for my cold brew pitcher. Worth trying
customer_reviews.author: Miraj Patel

customer_reviews.title: Marketing gimmick to promote an inferior product.
customer_reviews.text: You'd think this coffee would be a win-win; but the quality is so far inferior to every other coffee, the sentiment is lost. If the consequence of being environmentally conscience of the products we consume, results in this awful coffee... we're all doomed.
customer_reviews.author: waltonps

customer_reviews.title: I'm really happy with this coffee
customer_reviews.text: I'm really happy with this coffee. It makes a fantastic cold brew in my Blue Bottle cold brew maker. Very smooth, great color and well-balanced and smells incredible. The taste is amazing – doesn't have unnecessary ingredients. After a couple of weeks, I'm still looking forward to this coffee. This will be my go-to cold brew coffee for now on. And I absolutely love this is eco-conscious.
customer_reviews.author: J. Humphreys

customer_reviews.title: Not my cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: I'm not really picky when it comes to cold coffee taste but this one has got to go. They have to come out with something that doesn't taste as bland. Just not good.
customer_reviews.author: Christiani C.

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: This is literally the best coffee I've ever had. Right when I took the first sip I told my husband, "oh my gosh, this is the best coffee I've ever had." Will be ordering again.
customer_reviews.author: Baylee

customer_reviews.title: Throw out everything else and buy this
customer_reviews.text: We have tried TONS of coffee brands and this one wins them all! The flavor is excellent! This version makes awesome tasting, non bitter cold brew coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica T

customer_reviews.title: Coffee didn't taste that fresh
customer_reviews.text: This coffee had such amazing reviews, I thought I would try it, but honestly, I didn't think it was all that great. I prefer some of the local roasters with fresh, dark roasted coffee that has more complexity. I do like what the coffee stands for though, sorry I can't say it was as amazing in taste as I had hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Roxann

customer_reviews.title: Amazing coffee
customer_reviews.text: Amazing taste. Brews well. Smells so good you would wish they sold a candle version of it.
customer_reviews.author: Tina B

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried about 5 different types of coffee for our cold brew kit and this is the best tasting, hands down!
customer_reviews.author: colleen

customer_reviews.title: Smooth
customer_reviews.text: I was gifted my first bag of this coffee. Is it a great cold brew coffee. Strong and smooth. I loved it so much I purchased it again for myself.
customer_reviews.author: shanna

customer_reviews.title: and it was not bad at all
customer_reviews.text: I am NOT a coffee person- I got this for my mother. But one day I was feeling so tired and I gave this a try myself, and it was not bad at all! I usually hate coffee. So, if you are a person who enjoys coffee, I imagine this must be fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: WickedEvilQueen

customer_reviews.title: Quality taste, consistently for months! Recommend this
customer_reviews.text: Love this coffee. Have been using it as my regular cold brew coffee for months. I enjoy getting the grounds since cold brew takes a lot of volume to put through my home grinder. No complaints whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Joey K.

customer_reviews.title: Great taste and great company
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I make iced coffee in the evenings to have ready by morning. This is a great brand for taste and what they stand for. I subscribe to save a few extra cents, and it’s that much easier to keep stocked.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Newcomb

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: Awful best way to describe and l am a coffee snob..,
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cold brew coffee flavor!
customer_reviews.text: This makes awesome cold brew coffee. The flavor is amazing. Not to light not too strong. Bold mellow flavor. I will definitely be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nothing special
customer_reviews.text: Nothing special. For the money you could find better deals.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy A.

customer_reviews.title: Great flavor!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this coffee to make iced coffee in my Ninja coffee maker. This coffee has a great flavor and will definitely be buying more!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great.
customer_reviews.text: Good, but not great. The coffee has a somewhat metallic cardboard taste when used for cold brew. It can get the job done, but I personally wouldn't keep using it for cold brew.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph R

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Blend tastes great black, and the grind works perfectly In my cold brewer!
customer_reviews.author: NYgal

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for that coffee lover
customer_reviews.text: Have not tasted this coffee, but it smells awesome. Will be a Christmas gift
customer_reviews.author: jeannine pelletier

customer_reviews.title: Taste ok, very thick grounds.
customer_reviews.text: These grounds are very thick. Didn’t work well for my cold brewer. Taste was ok.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah M

customer_reviews.title: Buy this one!!
customer_reviews.text: Delicious coffee, and great customer service re: a missing bag. Flavor is lovely hot or cold and I plan to order again!!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Wife drinks it....
customer_reviews.text: What can i say she drinks it and loves the flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn O'Donnell

customer_reviews.title: Expires too soon
customer_reviews.text: Arrived timely but expiration date is next month, 9/20/20 😠
customer_reviews.author: LL

customer_reviews.title: Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite cold brew and is at a reasonable price!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great for cold brew
customer_reviews.text: I am using this coffee for a cold brew for iced coffee and it is delicious! It has a full-bodied taste! DEFINITELY will be buying again!
customer_reviews.author: lioness08332

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee
customer_reviews.text: This is good coffee. I do prefer the Bizzy brand over it. But I don’t have anything negative to say about it. It’s a matter of personal taste.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Good choice for cold press coffee makers
customer_reviews.text: This is a good coffee for cold press. I prefer to grind my own coffee but this is a good bet for when I run out or become lazy.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Gray

customer_reviews.title: Mild
customer_reviews.text: I drink iced coffee as my stomach has a temper now that I’m getting old. This is a solid coffee and seems to be a responsible company environment-wise. I would like to keep using, but the flavor isn’t exactly my cup of tea...err, coffee, I mean. Pretty mild. No bite though.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cold brew.
customer_reviews.text: Love this for use in my cold brew maker. I make the coffee quite strong, and love how smooth it is. I am impressed by the moral philosophy behind this coffee, plus I enjoy the product.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: has a great mission, and I love that it's already course ...
customer_reviews.text: Earthy and a bit more bitter than I was expecting. Tastes a bit stale, but it's a decent option for cold brew, has a great mission, and I love that it's already course ground.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia N

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Great medium taste when hot brewed through drip machine. Light to no taste through cold press.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Pinedo

customer_reviews.title: Especially love the "tiny footprint" part -- preserve the earth!
customer_reviews.text: GOOD coffee. Used 4:1 ratio and diluted the brewed coffee about 50/50. Best coffee I've ever had. Update -- bought this again on a lightening deal. No-brainer!
customer_reviews.author: Linda ScottTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not Dark Roast
customer_reviews.text: This is more if a light roast coffee and almost seems flavored. It is a bit smooth but not for those who like dark bold coffee. The grinds are also course, which is perfect for cold brew (as it claims to be)
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, horrible flavor
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of ethical sourced coffee, but oh my gosh this is inedible. It created a weird oily light coldbrew that was incredibly bitter.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Delicious!
customer_reviews.text: This is the most delicious coffee I have ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Sands of Time

customer_reviews.title: Its coffee!
customer_reviews.text: Not the best coffee I've ever had, but it's one of the few that I actually enjoy making cold brew with. Others taste really funky, but this ones nice and smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Graves

product_meta.title: Tiny Footprint Coffee - Organic Cold Brew Cold Press Elixir | Ground Coffee | USDA Organic | Carbon Negative | 16 Ounce
product_meta.description: Tiny Footprint Coffee, the world’s first carbon negative coffee. Through a unique collaboration between Roastery 7 and the Mindo Cloudforest Foundation, one an Artisan coffee roastery and the other a nonprofit conservation organization, the two teamed up to create the ultimate combination of good karma. So, how is our coffee carbon negative you might ask? It’s simple, really. It takes 4 lbs. of CO2 to produce and distribute 1 lb. of our coffee. For every pound that’s sold, we donate a portion of the proceeds to fund reforestation in Ecuador’s Mindo cloud forest. Over time, these trees will remove 54 lbs. of CO2 from the atmosphere. You see? More CO2 removed than emitted. Our reforestation efforts along the Northwestern Andes of Ecuador help to plant native tree species throughout the Mindo Cloud Forest region in heavily deforested areas. These trees not only sequester massive amounts of carbon from the air, but also provide habitat to hundreds of local bird species, reinforce soil conservation techniques, and rebuild water tables. The Mindo Cloudforest Foundation works directly with local landowners to provide jobs related to the care and redevelopment of the cloud forest. Making coffee great takes time, effort and passion. At Tiny Footprint Coffee, we pour endless hours into sourcing the finest, sustainably-grown Arabica coffee beans from around the world. Beans that are not only shade-grown, but also organic certified, and most often fair-trade or Rain Forest Alliance certified. We also purchase coffee from small, family-owned farms that are not fair-trade eligible, yet grow some of the most beautiful, best tasting coffees on the planet. We do all of the roasting and training from our roastery in Minneapolis, MN where we’re working hard to make the entire roastery carbon negative – from fully bio-degradable coffee bags, high-efficiency lighting and fuel-efficient ribbon burners on our roaster, to composting coffee grounds and reducing waste around the shop.
feature_bullets: The world's first carbon negative coffee: For every pound that’s sold, we donate a portion of the proceeds to fund reforestation in Ecuador’s Mindo cloud forest. Over time, these trees will remove 54 lbs. of CO2 from the atmosphere as well as provide habitat for native plant and animal species
GROUND COFFEE: 100% Organic Shade-Grown Arabica Coffee
A blend crafted perfectly for cold brew -- our Cold Press Elixir is a mix of our light and dark roasts spiked with our best Ethiopian coffees.
Flavor Profile: Sweet, silky richness with subtle bright fruit and floral tones infused in a cocoa like body.
Craft Roasted in our vintage 90 kilo German-built Probat drum roaster retrofitted with modern fuel-efficient ribbon burners, delivering perfectly roasted coffee every time
Each pound brews 1.5 gallons of ready-to-drink cold brew (1: 6 brew ratio and 1: 1 dilution)
